intro: Bothriocline hispida, commonly known as the rough-leaved everlet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Bothriocline hispida is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
